question: A wooden block of mass M lies on a rough floor. Another wooden block of the same mass is hanging from the point O through strings as shown in the figure. To achieve equilibrium, the co-efficient of static friction between the block on the floor with the floor itself is
images/547d3685-c1e0-419d-a021-f7b64cd82711.png
explanation: For the block on the floor to be in equilibrium, the horizontal component of tension must be balanced by the frictional force.
From the diagram (implied), <katex>$T\sin\theta = Mg$</katex> (vertical equilibrium of hanging mass or geometry) and <katex>$T\cos\theta = f_s = \mu N = \mu Mg$</katex>.
